intro: Minuartia olonensis, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, evergreen leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is adapted to grow in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Minuartia olonensis is typically found in mountainous regions and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
